title: The Today Show's Sophie Walsh admits she's always had a 'thing for gingers'
text:
The Today's Show Sophie Walsh has revealed her love for redheads.

Nine's Europe correspondent made the cheeky admission during a segment about megastar Ed Sheeran and Prince Harry.

She admitted: 'I've always had a thing for gingers.'

The blonde TV personality was reporting a segment on the duo's joint campaign to raise awareness around World Mental Health Day.

She was broadcasting live outside Buckingham Palace in the UK's capital on Thursday night (GMT).

Sophie told Today Show host Deborah Knight: 'They say laughter is the best medicine and that's certainly what we got today from Prince Harry and Ed Sheeran teaming up for World Mental Health Day, a cause very close to Harry's heart.'

The red-haired duo filmed a parody video in which Ed pretends to get the wrong end of the stick.

Dream team: Ed Sheeran and Prince Harry (pictured) have created a joint campaign to raise awareness around World Mental Health Day

Revelation: Nine's Europe correspondent Sophie Walsh (pictured) made the admission during a segment about megastar Ed Sheeran and Prince Harry

He tells the Prince of Sussex: 'People just don't understand what it's like to be us, with the jokes and snide comments.

'We are ginger and we're going to fight.'

Using his best acting skills, Prince Harry replies: 'Slightly awkward this. It might have been a miscommunication but this [the campaign] is about World Mental Health Day.'

Ed looks sheepish and says: 'Oh yeah, yeah, course. I definitely knew that.'

Good cause: The Prince of Sussex (pictured) filmed a parody video in which Ed pretends to get the wrong end of the stick

After the clip, the camera cuts back to a wrapped-up Sophie outside the famous palace.

She tells Deborah: 'I don't get it, I've always had a thing for gingers.

'But anyway Debs, the Duke of Sussex spent the day in Nottingham touring a school talking to kids about how better to deal with the stress of exams.'

Prince Harry has always been a staunch campaigner for mental health awareness, alongside his brother Prince William.

The pair have used their positions to talk openly about their mental health in a bid to break down stigma.
description: The Today's Show Sophie Walsh has revealed her love for redheads.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
